metadata.description: This ruleset provides analysis in both JBoss EAP 4 and 5 that may require individual attention when migrating to JBoss EAP 6 and 7.

hint.title: Replace service-style deployments
hint.message: MBeans were part of the core architecture in previous versions of Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform. JBoss Service Archive (SAR) deployments using the JBoss specific `jboss-service.xml` and `jboss-beans.xml` service-style descriptors were used by the application server to create MBeans based on JBoss Beans. The internal architecture has changed in JBoss EAP 6+ and is no longer based on an MBean JMX architecture.

link.title: How to change a jboss-service.xml / sar MBean Singleton to a Java EE 6 Singleton in JBoss EAP 6
Are service archives (sar), jboss-service.xml, JBoss MBeans, jboss-beans.xml recommended in JBoss EAP 6?

hint.title: Replace BarrierController service
hint.message: `BarrierController` service is no longer available in JBoss EAP 6+. In JBoss EAP 4.x the JBoss 'kernel' layer was an extension of JMX which is why everything was an MBean, though most of the MBean functionality still worked in JBoss EAP 5. JBoss EAP 6 is no longer based on Mbeans, and the Mbeans which are seen in jconsole are actually just facades over the JBoss management API, so declaring Mbean dependencies on any other Mbeans that appear to be JBoss Mbeans does not work since they are not real Mbeans.

hint.title: Replace CompressingMarshaller marshaller
hint.message: `CompressingMarshaller` marshaller is no longer available in JBoss EAP 6+. In JBoss EAP 6.3.0 and later, data compression hints can be specified via the JBoss annotation `org.jboss.ejb.client.annotation.CompressionHint`

link.title: How to compress remote EJB communication in JBoss EAP 6

hint.title: Replace Login Module definition
hint.message: In JBoss EAP 6+, Security is configured in the `<security-domain>` element in the server configuration file.

link.title: Configure UsersRolesLoginModule for EAP 6 management console

hint.title: Remove class-loading definition
hint.message: The `class-loading` and `loader-repository` configuration in `jboss.xml`, `jboss-web.xml` and `jboss-service.xml` were JBoss EAP 4.x & 5.x configuration options for specifying classloader isolation on a deployment. In JBoss EAP 6+, it uses JBoss Modules for its classloader implementation so all deployments are isolated in their own classloader / JBoss Module and the `loader-repository` is no longer valid. The `jboss-deployment-structure.xml` can be used to specify classloader / module dependencies if needed.

link.title: Unexpected element 'class-loading' in jboss-web.xml when migrating to JBoss EAP 6

hint.title: Create org.jboss.naming.NamingAlias class
hint.message: JBoss EAP 6 supports deploying SAR files, however JBoss EAP 5 and 6 do not share a lot of the internals. The class your `jboss-{types}.xml` file is trying to instantiate (`org.jboss.naming.NamingAlias`) was an implementation detail of JBoss EAP 5's naming components that does not exist in JBoss EAP 6.

link.title: NamingAlias ClassNotFoundException when migrating SAR to JBoss EAP 6

hint.title: Set authentication cache timeout
hint.message: In JBoss EAP 6 and 7 you can set the JAAS cache timeout, changing the `cache-type` to `infinispan` which uses Infinispan cache which has an expiration capability.

link.title: How to set authentication cache timeout in JBoss EAP6/7
